intro: Genipa jovis-tonantis, commonly known as the golden genipapo, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by fleshy, orange-red berries. Its leaves are alternate, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. The fruit is edible and has a unique flavor, often used in traditional cuisine and local beverages.
